Convert to Class "stock"

Source: R/as_stock.R
as_stock.Rd

Coerce a list containing historical financial data for a stock, a stock's options chain, or a commodity's price forward curve into an R object having class asset.

as_stock(identifiers, OHLCV, dividends, splits, exchange)

Arguments

identifiers

a named character vector whose names must be one of: Symbol, Name, ISIN, CIK, CUSIP, Valoren, SEDOL, FIGI. The value of the first identifier will be used as the name of the result returned. You may specify as many identifiers as you want, but you must specify at least one.
OHLCV

an xts object containing 5 columns: Open, High, Low, Close, and Volume data for a stock. Not case-sensitive.
dividends

an xts object containing at least one column named Cash or Stock, plus any number of additional columns desired in the result returned (such as "announced_date", "frequency", etc), indexed by Ex Date. The value of an element appearing in the Cash column is the cash amount, per share, that went ex-div on the date specified for index. Ditto for Stock.
splits

an xts object containing two columns named Denominator and Numerator. See Details.
exchange

the stock exchange on which the data were observed. Must be one of the values appearing in stock_exchange_hours$ID; e.g., "NYSE", "NASDAQ", etc. Not case-sensitive.
...

additional data to include, such as float, earnings_announcement, warrants, etc.

Rules

NA

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Rules
